data.title: Google's Fight Against Epic Games' Antitrust Win Hits Roadblock —Judges Tell Search Giant Apple Case Doesn't Apply
data.description: A federal appeals court appeared skeptical of Alphabet Inc.'s attempt to overturn Epic Games' antitrust victory, rejecting Google's argument that its case should be treated like Apple's successful defense in a similar lawsuit.

data.title: Tom Lee Says February Not 'Looking Great' For Bitcoin But Stocks Look Ripe For Picking Amid Trump Tariff Sell-Off
data.description: Renowned market strategist Tom Lee on Monday recommended buying stocks amid the recent market sell-off triggered by President Donald Trump’s tariffs but advised caution for Bitcoin (CRYPTO: BTC).

data.title: Elon Musk Appointed As 'Special Government Employee' Amid DOGE Department Push: 'Can't Do Anything Without Our Approval,' Says Trump
data.description: The White House has appointed Elon Musk, the wealthiest individual globally, as a “special government employee.” This designation allows Musk to be employed by the federal government while potentially sidestepping certain disclosure rules.

data.title: Aravind Srinivas, CEO Of Jeff Bezos-Backed Perplexity, Reveals Why Most Startups Fail: 'The Thing That Most People Get Wrong...'
data.description: Aravind Srinivas, CEO of Perplexity AI, warns that most startups fail because founders chase market trends rather than solving problems they are truly passionate about, leading to inevitable burnout and failure.

data.title: Salesforce Cuts 1000 Jobs But Ramps Up Hiring For AI Sales Roles
data.description: Salesforce Inc. is reportedly slashing 1,000 jobs as its latest fiscal year begins, Bloomberg reported on Monday, citing sources. Simultaneously, the company is hiring 2,000 employees for sales roles to promote its artificial intelligence products, according to CEO Marc Benioff's announcement in December.
